gurmukhi: KYc kY kwn pRmwn kmwn su Cyd hiRdw sr soN Air dIno ]bwNbI mY swp DisE kib ny jsu qw Cib ko iem cIno ]1411]
transliteration: Khaich Kai Kaan Pramaan Kamaan Su Chheed Hridaa Sar Son Ar(i) Deeno|| Baanbimai Saap Dhasio Kabi Ne Jas(u) Taa Chhab(i) Ko Im Cheeno||1411||
translation: Pulling his bow upto his ear, he pierced the heart of the enemy like a snake entering his hole.1411.

gurmukhi: bwnn sMig su mwir kY S`qRn rwm Bny As so pun mwrXo ]sRaun smUh prXo iqh qy Dr pRwn ibnw kr BU pr fwrXo ]
transliteration: Baanan San(i) Su Maar Kai Shattran Raam Bhane As So Poun Mdaryo|| Sraaoun Samoond Daryo Tih Te Dhar Praan Binaa Kar Bhoo Par Ddaryo||
translation: After killing the enemy with his arrows, he made killing with his sword; because of the war, the blood began to flow on the earth and making the bodies lifeless, he knocked them down on the ground;

gurmukhi: qw Cib kI aupmw liK kY kib ny muiK qy ieh BwNiq aucwrXo ]K`g lgXo iqh ko nhI mwnhu lY kr mY jmdMf pHwrXo ]1412]
transliteration: Taa Chhah(i) Kioupmaa Lakh(i) Kai Kabi Ne Moukh(i) Te Eh Bhaant(i) Ouchdaryo|| Khagg Lagyo Tih Ko Nahimaanoh Lai Kar Mai Jamdand Prahdaryo||1412||
translation: The poet describing this spectacle says that it appears that they had not been hit by the sword and instead, they had been knocked down on account of the punishment of Yama.1412.

gurmukhi: rwCs mwr lXo jb hI qb rwCs ko irskY dlu DwXo ]Awvq hI kib sXwm khY ibbDwXuD lY Aiq ju`D mcwXo ]
transliteration: Raachhas Maar Layo Jah Hitab Raachhas Ko Ris-kai Dal(u) Dhaayo|| Oovat Hikabi Syaam Kahai Bidhaa-yudh Lai At(i) Juddh Machadyo||
translation: When this demon was killed, then the army of demons in their fury, fell upon him; on their arrival, he began the war with different kinds of weapons;

gurmukhi: dYq Gny qh Gwiel h√çY bhu Gwien so KVgySih GwXo ]so sih kY As ko gih kY niRp ju`D kIXo nhI Gwau jqwXo ]1413]
transliteration: Dait Ghane Tah Ghaail Hvai Bahu Ghaain So Khadgeshah(i) Ghaayo|| So Sh(i) Kai As Ko Gadh Kai Nrip Juddh Keeyo Nahighaao Jataayo||1413||
translation: Many of the demons were wounded at that place and Kharag Singh also received many wounds; enduring the agony of the wounds, the king fought and did not expose his wounds.1413.

gurmukhi: Dwie pry sB rwCis Xw pr hY iqn kY mn kop bFXo ]gih bwn kmwn gdw brCI iqn imAwnhu qy krvwr kFXo ]
transliteration: Dhaae Dare Sabh Raachhas(i) Yaa Par Hai Tin Kai Man Kop Badhyo Gadh Haan Kamaan Gadaa Barchhitin Miaanoh Te Karvaar Kadhyo||
translation: All the demons fell upon him with increased anger; taking up their bows, arrows, maces, daggers etc., they also drew out their swords from the scabbards;

gurmukhi: sB dwnv qyj pRcMf kIXo irs pwvk mY iqn AMg fFXo ]ieh BwNq pHwrq hY niRp kau qn kMcn mwno sunwr gFXo ]1414]
transliteration: Sabh Daanav Tej Prachanndd Keeyo Ris Paavak Mai Tin An Dadhyo|| Eh Bhaant Prahaarat Hai Nrip Kau Tan Kanchanndmaano Sounaar Gadhyo||1414||
translation: In the fire of ire, their life-energy increased and their limbs god instigated; they were striking their blows on the king like a goldsmith fashionable a body of gold.1414.

gurmukhi: ijnhUM niRp ky sMig ju`Du kIXo su sBY ienhU hiq kY qb dIny ]Aaur ijqy Air jIq bcY iqn ky bD kau kir AwXuD lIny ]
transliteration: Jinhoon Nrip Ke San(i) Juddh(u) Keeyo Su Sabhai Idhoodhat(i) Kai Tab Deene|| Aur Jite Ar(i) Jeet Bachai Tin Ke Badh Kau Kar(i) Aayudh Leene||
translation: All those who fought with the king were killed and in order to kill the remaining enemies, he caught hold of his weapons in his hands;

gurmukhi: qau ien BUp srwsn lY kIey S`qRn ky qn muMfn hIny ]jo n fry su lry pun Dwie indwn vhI niRp KMfn kIny ]1415]
transliteration: Tau In Bhoop Saraasan Lai Keee Shattran Ke Tan Mounndan Heene|| Jo Na Dare Su Dare Poun Dhaae Nidaan Vahinrip Khanndan Keene||1415||
translation: Taking his bow and arrows in his hands, the kings made their bodies headless and those who still persisted to fight with him, were all destroyed.1415.

gurmukhi: bIr bfo iek dYq huqo iqn kop kIXo Aiq hI mn mY ]ieh BwNiq so BUp kau bwn hny sB Pokn lau gfgy qn mY ]
transliteration: Beer Bado Ik Dait Houto Tin Kop Keeyo At(i) Himan Mai|| Eh Bhaant(i) Bhoop Kau Baan Hane Sabh Phokan Lau Gadge Tan Mai||
translation: There was one very big demon warrior, who is extreme anger discharged many arrows on the king; these arrows penetrated into the body of the king till the final end;
